name: Pizza
content: As the owner of a pizza restaurant, you must make pizzas as fast as possible to satisfy your hungry customers. You can cook as many pizzas simultaneously as you have ovens available.
input: The first line of input will consist of four integers: n (1 ≤ n ≤ 1000), the number of customers; s (1 ≤ s ≤ 20), the number of slices on a pizza; o (1 ≤ o ≤ 100), the number of ovens you have available; and t (1 ≤ t ≤ 100), the time in minutes it takes to cook one pizza. Each of the following n lines will contain an integer, i (1 ≤ i ≤ 100), the number of slides that customer wants, and a string, p, the type of pizza that customer wants. p will only have lowercase letters.
output: Output one integer: the minimum number of minutes it will take to cook pizzas for all customers.
